ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a good knowledge of differential topology, and also learned how to approach a course where much of the work is self guided.
I learned a lot from this course. I can appreciate The art of pure maths now. I improved my intellectual level
I got an idea about the concepts of abstract manifolds and the objects defined on them.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think assigning some required exercises would be useful, because it would allow students to get feedback on course material before exams. It would also force students to keep a regular schedule with internalizing the material, which I think would benefit students' understanding of the course material.

The lecturer gave an intuitive picture of the presented topics. This is very helpful. However, to actually use all this one also needs to be familiar with the formal definitions and proofs. This came a bit short in the class. Homework assignments would be extremely helpful to get the hands on the concepts.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend it because the material is interesting, but I would caution any student that to keep up with the course material requires significant work outside of class. The exams are extremely difficult, and it takes a lot of work to be adequately prepared for them.
